info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central McDowell, southeastern Mitchell and southeastern Yancey Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Spruce Pine, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, North Cove, Busick, Pleasant Gardens, Celo, Little Switzerland and Woodlawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
